meanings.definition: Feeling or showing envy or resentment towards someone because of their achievements or advantages.
meanings.sent1: She was the jealousest student in the class when her friend got a higher grade.
meanings.sent2: The jealousest sister couldn't hide her envy when her sibling won the competition.
meanings.sent3: The jealousest cat in the house hissed at the new kitten getting all the attention.
meanings.sent4: His jealousest thoughts towards his colleague's promotion consumed him.
meanings.sent5: The green-eyed monster made her the jealousest person in the room.

meanings.definition: Feeling or showing suspicion or fear of being replaced in a relationship.
meanings.sent1: He became the jealousest boyfriend whenever she talked to other guys.
meanings.sent2: The jealousest partner always checked their significant other's phone for messages.
meanings.sent3: The jealousest puppy growled at anyone who approached its owner.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt the jealousest pang when she saw her ex with someone new.
meanings.sent5: The jealousest lover's insecurities drove a wedge between them.

meanings.definition: To be protective or possessive of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She jealousest over her little brother, making sure he was always safe.
meanings.sent2: The mother jealousest over her newborn, never letting anyone else hold the baby.
meanings.sent3: The dog jealousest over its favorite toy, not allowing any other pet near it.
meanings.sent4: He jealousest over his girlfriend, not wanting her to spend time with anyone else.
meanings.sent5: The queen jealousest over her kingdom, fiercely protecting it from invaders.
